ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] OT - Equipment question
ygData.msgSnippet: Lol, read the _whole_ of my last post: ** Snipped some ** ... disk). ** Snipped some more** And youre right defragging is a good thing, but EQ is on its own
ygData.messageBody:
Lol, read the _whole_ of my last post:
** Snipped some **
>I figure that my HD is due for an upgrade next(got a lousy UDMA33 4GB
disk).
** Snipped some more**

And youre right defragging is a good thing, but EQ is on its own partitition
and I keep it very clean ;).
Further more I have a permanent swap disk of 500 MB (I want to try and go
without swapping at all now that I have 256 mem, W98 sucks at mem handling).
However I am pretty confident that the only thing that will really help me
is a new harddisk ;)


Musiker

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Daniel Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
> Sent: 13. juni 2001 09:53
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] OT - Equipment question
>
>
> Well you clearly have excellent memory (and upgrade didn't help
> surprisingly); and a decent video card (for EQ at least) -
> but of course the
> videocard can't be an issue for the server select screen.
>
> My guess is that the problem is your hard disk. Either you
> don't have a
> hard disk - or perhaps it's severely fragmented - have you run defrag
> lately?
>
> If you are good about maintenance it's probably a slow drive... Your
> process is a bit on the slower side (by new PC standards) but
> is reasonable
> fast otherwise (again esp. for EQ).
>
> Take a look at HD issues...
>
> Slyde
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Henrik Holm [mailto:HEH@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, June 13, 2001 12:54 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] OT - Equipment question
>
>
> As other mentioned GeForce cards are IMO also most bang for the bucks.
> Ive not upgraded in a while:
> Processor: Athlon 600MHz
> RAM: PC133 256Mb SDRAM
> Sound: Soundblaster live (First version on the market)
> Graphics: ASUS 6800 (GeForce 1 with 32MB DDR RAM)
> Network: 10Mbit LAN to a ADSL 256kb/sec
>
> Only annoying problem I have is loading time from server
> select screen to
>
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> lol@... with the subject submissions.
